result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L. Mathis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bond in this case applied to 15-CF-238.

Defendant Joshua L. Mathis in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF124, 15CF238, 15CF244, 15CM159, & 16CF24 @ 9:00 am.   16CF24, 15CF238, 15CF124 Need to waive p.h. 15CF244 DRI so need to waive p.h.   Atty Casey just talked to def regarding waiving p.h.   15CF124, 15CF38, Court goes over Waiver of preliminary examination. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause on all 3 cases & bind over on all charges. 15CF124, plea to ct 1, 15CF238 pleas to ct 1 & ct 4, 16CF24 plea to ct 3, remaining charges with be DRI and 15CF244 & 15CM159 will be DRI, 15CF124, ct 1 withheld sentence 3 years probation, 90 days jail, 15CF238, ct 1 withheld sentence 3 probation, ct 4 5 days jail, 1429 fine totaling, DNA Surcharge, 12 months revocation, IID, 16CF24 ct 3 withheld sentence 3 years.  15CF124, 5 days credit, Court question if revoke, State agrees. Atty Casey clarifies some counties do different. Judge verifies will be given credit if revoked. 15CF238 7 days credit, will go towards ct 4 and time served.16CF24 7 days credit, Atty Casey brings up refusal will be dismissed.  Atty Casey request to vacate forfeitures.  State agrees with Atty Casey.  Def. agrees. 15CF124, 15CF38 16CF24 Informations Filed. Atty Casey has copy of informations & waives reading.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalties. 15CF124 Ct 1 Manf/Dlvr THC, repeater, Guilty, 15CF238 Ct 1 Bail jumping, Guilty, Ct 4 Operate with restricted controlled substance 2nd, Guilty 16CF24 Ct 3 Bail jumping, repeater, Guilty.  16CF24 DRI Ct's 1 2 4 & 5.  DRI 15CM159, DRI 15CF244, 15CF238 Dismissed ct's 2 & 3, 15CF124 Dismissed ct's 2 3 & 4. Court now calls 15TR1043, City Atty not present but agreement has been reached so Court will Dismiss w/o prejudice.  Court advised of constitutional rights and J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. Atty Casey has wrong jury instruction attached to plea agreement. State & Atty Casey go over element on Manf/Deliver THC. Court reads statute to def. Def. admits prior conviction of OWI. Victim rights have complied with. One victim is in the courtroom  Atty Casey is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Court has reviewed complaint several times.  Stipulated to factual basis and State gives facts and defendant criminal history.  Atty Casey stipulate to fact in complaints. Court finds factual basis, accept pleas & finds def. Guilty to 15CF124 ct 1 Manf/Deliver THC, repeater, 15CF238 Ct 1 Bail jumping, & Ct 4 Operate w/restricted controlled substance 2nd, 16CF24 ct 3 Bail jumping, repeater. State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Casey gives sentencing recommendation. N.M. makes statement.  Def. makes statement. Court accepts agreement & orders on 
15CF124 Ct 1 withheld prison sentence 3 years probation, 90 days jail, 5 days credit if revoked, C. no later than 7-1-16 @ 6 pm., costs, Bond returned to poster, Def claims paid back poster, Bond will be applied to costs, 250 DNA surcharge, & DNA Sample. Court will reserve right for poster to file small claim, Huber privileges. Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. 
15CF238 Ct 1 withheld prison sentence 3 year probation, cost only, 250 DNA Surcharge, Bond to be applied to costs & fines in ct 4 
Ct 4 5 days jail, 1429 totaling fine & costs, 200 DNA Surcharge, 50 IID surcharge, Atty Casey questions IID, Court will reserved rights if no IID is to be ordered. 12 months revocation, 12 months IID, AODA & follow though, 7 days credit time served.
16CF24 Ct 3 withheld prison sentence 3 years probation, costs & 250 DNA surcharge, Bond to be applied to costs & balance apply to other case, Poster can file small claims will reserve right for both sides, 15CF244, 100 bond applied to outstanding costs, 15CM159 To be applied to other cases. 7 days credit if revoked. 
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Court adjourns @ 10:15 am.

Attorney David Gardner Casey in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF238, 16CF24, 16CF124,15CM159, 15CF244.  Matters will be adjourned until 2-22-16 and 16CF24 will be called at 3:00 pm  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua L. Mathis in court with attorney David Gardner Casey appearing by telephone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF124 and 15CM159 @ 1:19 p.m. State has moved to forfeit both bonds. Notices were mailed to posters. One notice was returned. State gives grounds for motion. Atty Casey asks issue track along with the cases, gives arguments. State agrees to have matter track along. Court approves and will reserve ruling.  15CF238 - Atty Casey asks 2/1/16 bond forf. hearing be taken off and follow with others. State does not object. Court grants.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing, Returned - Unable to Forward

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua L. Mathis
Current: N3844 Polar Rd, Polar, WI 54418 United States  (Effective: 12-28-2015)
Prior: 1610 Clermont St., #311, Antigo, WI 54409 United States

Defendant Joshua L. Mathis not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CM159 & 15CF124  @ 11:34 am. State moves to lift no contact provision in 15CM159 & 15CF124 has a no contact provision also.  Court will remove no contact provision with N.M. be lifted.  COC to give copy of minutes to jail.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua L. Mathis
Current: 1610 Clermont St., #311, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2015)
Prior: N3844 Polar Road, Polar, WI 54418

Defendant Joshua L. Mathis in court with attorney Gary Stephen Dodge.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CM159 & 15CF124.  Complaints reviewed.  Waive time limits for preliminary hearing.  15CM159 Initial appearance.  Disorderly conduct as repeater.  Not guilty plea entered.  Def has posted $150.00  State moves to forfeit bond, pending hearing.  Will put bond hearing on hold.  Request no contact   Court will set bond at $150.00 will hold off bond forfeiture  No contact provision  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
